intro: Hieracium transiens subsp. stribrnyanum, commonly known as the Stribrnyanum Hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. The subspecies is distinguished by its finely striated leaves and specific geographic distribution.
